title: Propex Heater where do peeps store gas bottle?

posts.content:
I've purchased a Propex heater to install in my bus. I was wondering where other peeps keep the gas bottle to comply with Gas safety Regs.
Do you not bother and just install near each other or do you have a separate compartment for Gas bottle.
Any advice or info would be great.
Cheers
Paul

I have posted pictures of my Heater install in my Peebles thread...but on a Devon with a rear seat.
To pass gas safety regulations you need a 1" hole in your floor near to the gas bottle/ Appliance . Propane/butane is heavy so flows along the floor and in theory through the hole to escape.
My Devon had the bottle there in 1964 I have just added the Heater and cut off valves etc.
Works great for me. Most Devon Caravettes after 1963 have the gas bottle inside.
Early RHD Devons had the gas bottle in the engine compartment on the passenger side on the bottle tray..
Needs to be secured and strapped as well. Some use a hard foot to keep bottle in place plus a strap.
G

Mines Fitted in the engine compartment (where originally intended), left hand side. No problems at all. As Graham says, needs to be secured down properly. I drew round the bottom collar of the gas bottom onto a piece of 18mm MDF. I then drew a larger circle round that approx 30mm away from the inner circle. Cut along both lines with a jig saw making a "hoop". The hoop was then drilled through and bolted to the left hand tray. All waterproofed underneath and away you go. The hoop secures it in one spot perfectly. Then attach a strap to the "hoop" which goes over your gas bottle.

Hth
